thread.title: Big Dig springs big leaks - Massachusetts news
thread.title_full: Big Dig springs big leaks - Massachusetts news

author: boston.com
title: Big Dig springs big leaks - Massachusetts news
text:
Boston’s tunnels built as part of the Big Dig are leaking, and state taxpayers are on the hook for cleaning up the mess. The Boston Herald reported that taxpayers are paying up to $7 million a year to address the problem.
More than 16 million gallons of water leaked into the Tip O’Neill Tunnel, the Ted Williams Tunnel, and the I-90 Connector in both 2013 and 2014. During the first six months of this year alone, the tunnels have taken on another 16 million gallons, reporter the Herald .
Related Link Get today’s headlines right in your inbox Engineers originally said the tunnel leaks would be sealed, but now officials are saying they’ll always leak according to the Herald .
 Read the full story in the Boston Herald .
